intro: Parascopolia acapulcensis, commonly known as the Mexican morning glory, is a climbing vine native to Central America. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of purple and pink. The plant belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is known for its rapid growth habit. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and greenhouses.
